lines.text: Good morning, darling!
Good morning dear! Well, our son is an idiot!
We've known that for years, haven't we, darling?
Well, this time he has surpassed himself. The ghosts are furious!
Why?
Well, they've heard that that Jim Brogan fellow is going to move the castle to Malibu!
Oh, how nice! All that sunshine and all those movie stars!
No respectable ghost would live in California!

[Peter is about to hang himself]
Oh! Taking the easy way out, you naughty boy!
Mother, please! This is not easy, this is very, very difficult!

[looks over the seat at Brother Tony after everyone's clothing has been ripped off]
Oh! So all the snakes weren't driven out of Ireland.
What?
[trying to cover himself]
Snakes. ha ha ha ha
[laughing hysterically]
Tonight's the one night I turn to flesh so... what d'ya say to a wee bit o' skelpin', eh? Come on. At least tell me your name.
[He vanishes under the sheet]

[She lifts up the sheet and sees his naked body]
Wow!
Oh, really? I've got the best bahookies from here to Ballinderry. Come on, what do you say? Let's give it a twirl, eh?

[She drops the sheet and continues filing her nails]
Drop dead.
Ooooh, God, what a woman.
That was a dirty trick wasn't it, eh? Eh? Kicking me right in the bahoogies.
You were going to stab your wife with a sword, you pig.
Ah, sure, that's no big thing. I do it every night.
Oh, and I suppose watching other men's wives in the bathtub is no big deal either.

[backs Sharon against a wall]
Sure, it's a grand thing if the wife happens to be you.
[leans in for a kiss]

[moves away]
You dirty peeping Tom.
My name's not Thomas. It's Martin.

[on the phone with Jim Brogan]
Sir, once again I must remind you that my first name is not "dick". Nor is my surname "face". It is simply "Peter". "Peter Plunkett"... No, I was not given a middle name but I'm sure if I had, my mother would not have chosen "shit-for-brains peckerhead"... Well then clearly you know a side to my mother that I have been happily sheltered from. Nevertheless I marvel at your colorfully creative ever so American colloquialism which flow so trippingly from your razor-like tongue!
Your father's so worried, he's tearing his hair out!
Mother, father has been dead for a decade
And what about your grandmother? How do you think she feels?
Mother, grandmother is dead too!
She's still upset
All I wanted to be was happily useless, you made me miserably useless.

[speaking to the ghost of his father in the office]
What did you have to give me this place for? You knew I was an incompetent! All I wanted to be was happily useless. You made me miserably useless. What did you give me this place for?
[starts throwing papers up into the air]

baths to run, bills to be paid, and then dying on me, just like that! Most people give some warning, you know. Premature senility, angina, gout, bed-ridden for years... but not you. Oh, no, no, no. Healthy as an old goat, you pop off one day in the orchard. And what then? Not a god-damned word, not a whisper? Did it never occur to you I might need some advice?... I missed you Daddy
Aww! Give your daddy a hug...
[goes to hug his father, and falls through him, landing on the floor]
Oh, sorry. Peter.
Hi, Marty!
[surprised after Martin has come flying through the window to pin Jack to the wall]
Where's the wife?
[Jack points towards the stairs; Martin looks at Mary and turns back]
Not mine, you dolt. Yours!
[Mary has just aged 200 years]
Kiss you? Maybe we should get some moisturizer first... or some medical supervision.
[Mary has just aged 200 years]
Jack, you threw me over for this? This... ugh! I mean I know you like passive women, Jack, but she's half dead. I hope she has a great personality, because this hurts.
[Sharon is flossing her teeth, seemingly unaware of Jack's presence]
Now that I'm dead, I though I'd let you know. You're as cold as a penquin on an iceburg. You're a dwarf. Yeah, clean those choppers so you can chew up the next jerk that comes along.

[Sharon slaps him]
I'm not dead?
No, but if I were you I wouldn't make any long term plans!
My love, my reason for dying.

[Jack and Sharon are witnessing Mary and Martin's fatal argument]
This is Mary the ghost, and that's Martin the ghost! They're having problems in their relationship.
No, Jack. We're having problems in our relationship!

[sees large bricks coming out of the wall behind him as he drinks]
What is going on here? Eamon? Why are chunks of masonry floating about?

[trying to seduce Sharon]
Madam, for you I missed my wedding for the first time in years, that's how much I want you. Sure, I know I'm a ghost and a murderer but forget about all that.
Oh my God! He's got my underwear!
Oh, very nice, a pervert ghost!
I'm dead. So this is what it feels like. Like a hangover.
You're a ghost, I'm an American. It would never work out.
Eternity's a big commitment.
If he kills me one more time, I'll *scream*!
Father Tony... What are you doing in the pool?
The Lord works in mysterious ways.

So, I was seeing this guy and he's a devil worshiper, right? Well, he's a hairdresser really, but he devil-worships on the side. And we booked this dumb tour because, you know, he likes ghosts, dead gerbils, that kind of thing... and he ran off with this Bhuddist monk! I mean, how I was supposed to know he was gay? So what about you, are you gay too?
Uh, no, I'm not. I'm - I'm chaste!
Just kidding! Trick question!

[hanging from the castle awning]
The things I do for you!

[looking on as the bus recklessly drives away]
Deeply appreciated... oh dear, oh dear, oh dear.
If I cannot send your payment, how on earth do you expect to transport an entire castle across the sea? The number of stamps alone is mind boggling!

[practicing their respective hauntings, to Julia]
I should like to be the tart on the horse, and you could be the hag in the tree.

[as the bus crashes into the lake]
Don't panic, she's amphibious, or so I'm told.
Those of you with nervous dispositions would do well to protect yourself. Lock your windows, bolt your doors, say your prayers, for tonight, they may be walking abroad...
But there are no bloody ghosts here!
I know, but there will be. We'll invent them!

[after the hotel staff has 'performed', the hall is left in darkness]
Where did they all go?
Don't ask. They might come back.

[sees Jack, about Mary]
You do love her, don't you?
Yeah, I guess I do. I - I don't know.
Then what's the problem then?
She's a ghost. She's dead, I'm alive.
[goes amazed]
How do you know all this?

[smiles]
I'm married to one.
